meanings.sent1: She hyed to catch the bus before it left.
meanings.sent2: The squirrel hyed across the yard to reach the tree.
meanings.sent3: The pizza delivery guy hyed to deliver the pizza before it got cold.
meanings.sent4: Time hyed along as they raced against the clock.
meanings.sent5: The wind hyed through the trees, rustling the leaves in its haste.

meanings.definition: To have gone quickly or swiftly.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit hyed away from the fox to safety.
meanings.sent2: The children hyed to the playground after school.
meanings.sent3: The cat hyed up the stairs to escape the dog.
meanings.sent4: The river hyed towards the sea, carrying debris along.
meanings.sent5: The car hyed down the highway, passing other vehicles in a blur.

meanings.definition: To have moved rapidly or speedily.
meanings.sent1: The athlete hyed towards the finish line, determined to win.
meanings.sent2: The storm clouds hyed across the sky, darkening the day.
meanings.sent3: The students hyed to finish their project before the deadline.
meanings.sent4: The news of the sale hyed through the office, sparking excitement.
meanings.sent5: The train hyed through the countryside, whistling as it passed by.
